body: Would it make sense to have this without checking if a computer is shared or not? I think it is nice to see a notification window saying that GUI Authentication User/pwd has not been set, until user clicks on OK or Don't Show Again.

![whatsapp image 2018-09-21 at 12 22 17 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9316467/45877005-b9874d00-bd9c-11e8-81e6-5bc969894f76.jpeg) We found the relevant piece of code at index.html, however it seems like this will never be triggered since ng-include directive is not there. existing relevant code: `

Danger!

The Syncthing admin interface is configured to allow remote access without a password. This can easily give hackers access to read and change any files on your computer. Please set a GUI Authentication User and Password in the Settings dialog.

` is this on purpose or are we looking for a more graceful msg there which does not enforce the user to go to the settings but can also pass by clicking on OK ? and if yes, i guess old one needs to be cleaned up?

This is different but related. This triggers when the admin interface is bound to something other than localhost, when auth should *really* be configured. This ticket is about something softer and easier that would trigger even when still on localhost, to guide rather than admonish.

issue.title: Suggest setting up auth on initial startup (fixes #4703)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body: ### Purpose Suggest user for setting `User` and `Password` in GUI Authentication, if not set. Suggest setting up auth on initial startup (fixes #4703) ### Testing None ### Screenshots If `User` and `Password` not set, initial startup this information panel shows up. Clicking: - `OK` closes panel. And panel will shows up again 1 weeks later in loading (if user and password not set). - `Settings` opens settings for setting relevant boxes. After setting user and password, panel will shows off. Except cleaning user and password, panel never shows up again. Localstroge key `authWarningDismissed` holds `true` and `false` and `authWarningDismissed` holds expiration time when it set clicking `OK` button. ### Documentation Not needed.

body: Is this issue still open? And if so, can I work on it? I might need some help, since I'm new to the project
It is, and sure, no permission required ;)
